results.title: Frantic
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Tim Hampton, Thom Mount, Warner Bros Pictures and Mount Company
results.brief_description: Dr. Richard Walker (Harrison Ford), an American cardiologist, is plunged into an emotional nightmare when he discovers his wife has mysteriously vanished during their visit to Paris. He sets out to find her, and begins to fear the city itself as he grapples with a bewildering web of language, locale, laissez-faire cops and indifferent bureaucrats. Walker’s only chance at finding his wife alive seems to rest with a streetwise waif with underworld connections (Emmanuelle Seigner). Cast also includes Betty buckley, JHohn Mahoney, Jimmie Ray Weeks, David Huddleston.

results.title: The Manxman
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and British International Pictures
results.brief_description: Guilt and love gone awry are the themes of this early Hitchcock film, the last of his silent films. Peter, a fisherman and Philip, a rich lawyer, have been friends since their childhood but fall in love with the same woman. Peter asks Philip to propose for him, but Kate’s father does not approve of the marriage. Peter leaves to seek his fortune and Philip courts Kate. When they hear of Peter’s death, the two become lovers. However Peter returns and marries Kate and she bears Philip’s child. Based on the classic theme of the eternal triangle. Although this Hitchcock film is not as well known, it is a must-see for film buffs.

results.title: No man of her own
results.brief_description: Clark Gable and Carole Lombard were one of Hollywood’s legendary couples, but unlike Bogart and Bacall, they only made one film together. Babe Stewart (Clark Gable) is a big time card shark, forced to hide in a small mid-western town where he meets Connie Randall (Carole Lombard), the local librarian whom he marries on a bet. Her innocence and sincerity act as a foil to his sauveness and eventually he is reformed by goodness and love. Co-starring Dorothy MacKaill.

results.title: Voyage of the damned
results.creator_credit: Stuart Rosenberg, Robert Fryer and Associated General Films
results.brief_description: A gripping, moving film with an all star cast and based on the book by Gordon Thomas and Max Morgan-Witts. It is the tragic tale of 937 German Jewish refugees who left Nazi Germany in 1939 on a ship bound for Cuba. The voyage was part of a propaganda exercise by Goebbels who had arranged that the ship would not be allowed to dock in Havana. As the ship headed towards the United States, President Roosevelt denied entry to the ship. A return to Hamburg would mean certain death in the concentration camps, a fate which the passengers resolved to prevent.

results.title: Crossroads
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Mark Carliner and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Long ago, Willie Brown bargained his soul with the Devil at the crossroads in return for fame. Gifted young guitarist Eugene (Ralph Maccio) will do anything to play the blues like his legendary hero and travels across country where he meets the now old and cantankerous Willie. Together they journey to the fated crossroads and Eugene learns that to really play the blues, you must live them first. Joe Seneca and Jami Gertz also star in this production which features an incredible soundtrack by Ry Cooder.

results.title: Love and anarchy = Film d'amore e d'anarchia
results.brief_description: In the chaotic Italy of the 1930s, Tunin (Giancarlo Giannini) is a young peasant radical who goes to the big city in order to assassinate Mussolini. His underground contact is Salome (Mariangela Melato) who is a Madame of a brothel. As in all her film work, Wertmuller combines sexual comedy with a sharp and subversive reworking of socialist and feminist themes. As the film progresses and we see the interaction between prostitutes, anarchists and Fascists, we become less sure of what is real and what is merely artiface in the world of politics. Wertmuller has pioneered a cinema that reveals politics is as much a style as it is didactism, as much performance as it is commitment. The poor foolish Tunin, who believes in love and justice, is the archetype of the Fool. The music is by Nino Rota. Winner of a prize at the 1973 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: The Remains of the day
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, John Calley, Mike Nichols, Ismail Merchant, Merchant Ivory Productions and Columbia
results.brief_description: Kazuo Ishiguro’s novel is lovingly brought to the screen in this lavish and finely crafted study of English class relations. Anthony Hopkins, in a stunning Academy Award nominated performance, is a butler who has been a gentleman’s gentleman: propriety and service are everything. Even his master’s sympathies for the emerging Nazi Party in Germany do not affect his work. However, on looking back at his life he decides that he was mistaken to choose his work over his emotional attachment to the only woman he has loved (Emma Thompson). Slipping back and forth from the late 1950s to the late 1930s, “Remains of the Day” is both an affecting romance and a sharp and sometimes very sad, very touching examination of how the British class system trapped people into a betrayal of their individual aspirations. It is also a study of how the emerging politics of the Cold War were to finally irrevocably alter those class relations, as America rather than Europe was to dominate as a world power. Co-starring Christopher Reeve and James Fox.

results.title: College
results.creator_credit: James W. Horne, Buster Keaton, Joseph Schenck and Buster Keaton Productions
results.brief_description: Buster goes to college and becomes sports obsessed when his lady love considers him less than manly. Spending a fortune on every imaginable piece of sporting apparatus, Buster is determined to muscle his way into her affections. This film is representative of Keatons madcap antics and incredible stunts with a grand comic finale which will leave the audience reeling.

results.title: Blood and sand
results.creator_credit: Fred Niblo, Jesse L Lasky and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Rudolph Valentino is Juan Gallardo, a poor boy who realises his ambition to become one of Spain’s greatest matadors. When he marries his childhood sweetheart it seems as if his dreams will be fulfilled, but he soon falls prey to a seductress. Ultimately, Gallardo is defeated as much by his own conduct as by the events in the arena. This Valentino feature prompted a series of films about bullfighters, however it is this film which sees Valentino at his “scorching” best.

results.title: The Trojan women
results.brief_description: A joint Greek and American production based on Euripedes’ play “The Trojan women”. Katharine Hepburn is Hecube, the wife of King Priam; Vanessa Redgrave is Andromache, the widow of Hector; Genevieve Bujold is Cassandra, the cursed prophetess of Apollo and Trojan Princess and Irene Papas is the beautiful Helen of Troy. The victors of the Trojan war ransack the city and take as part of their spoils, the women and children. The play tells of their bitter struggle to survive the cruelty of defeat and capture.
